dt: {bc}to rescue or deliver from danger or harm
{bc}to preserve or guard from injury, destruction, or loss
{bc}to store (data) in a computer or on a storage device (such as a CD or {d_link|flash drive|flash drive})
{bc}to put aside as a store or reserve {bc}{sx|accumulate||}
{bc}to keep from being lost to an opponent
{bc}to prevent an opponent from scoring or winning

pt: {sc}rescue{/sc} {sc}deliver{/sc} {sc}redeem{/sc} {sc}ransom{/sc} {sc}reclaim{/sc} {sc}save{/sc} mean to set free from confinement or danger. {sc}rescue{/sc} implies freeing from imminent danger by prompt or vigorous action.

pt.t: {it}rescued{/it} the crew of a sinking ship

pt: {sc}deliver{/sc} implies release usually of a person from confinement, temptation, slavery, or suffering.
{sc}redeem{/sc} implies releasing from bondage or penalties by giving what is demanded or necessary.

pt.t: job training designed to {it}redeem{/it} school dropouts from chronic unemployment

pt: {sc}ransom{/sc} specifically applies to buying out of captivity.
{sc}reclaim{/sc} suggests a bringing back to a former state or condition of someone or something abandoned or debased.
{sc}save{/sc} may replace any of the foregoing terms; it may further imply a preserving or maintaining for usefulness or continued existence.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}salver{/it}, from Late Latin {it}salvare{/it}, from Latin {it}salvus{/it} safe {ma}{mat|safe|}{/ma}
shortdef: to rescue or deliver from danger or harm
to preserve or guard from injury, destruction, or loss

dt: {bc}a play that prevents an opponent from scoring or winning
{bc}the action of a relief pitcher in baseball in successfully protecting a team's lead

shortdef: a play that prevents an opponent from scoring or winning
the action of a relief pitcher in baseball in successfully protecting a team's lead; also : official credit for a save

et: Middle English {it}sauf{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}sauve{/it}, from {it}sauf{/it}, adjective, safe {ma}{mat|safe|}{/ma}

dt.t: of his earlier years little is known, {wi}save{/wi} that he studied violin

dt: used before a word often taken to be the subject of a clause

dt.t: no one knows about it {wi}save{/wi} she

shortdef: except for the fact that : only —used with that
but, except —used before a word often taken to be the subject of a clause

dt: river 400 miles (644 kilometers) long in southeastern Africa rising in central Zimbabwe and flowing east across southern Mozambique to the Indian Ocean

shortdef: river 400 miles (644 kilometers) long in southeastern Africa rising in central Zimbabwe and flowing east across southern Mozambique to the Indian Ocean

dt: {bc}something that prevents waste, loss, or damage (such as a receptacle for catching waste products for further use)

shortdef: something that prevents waste, loss, or damage (such as a receptacle for catching waste products for further use)

dt: {bc}to stop someone from dying or being killed

dt.t: If you donate blood, you might {it}save a life{/it}.

shortdef: to stop someone from dying or being killed

dt: {bc}to avoid having other people lose respect for oneself

dt.t: He tried to {it}save face{/it} by working overtime.

shortdef: to avoid having other people lose respect for oneself

dt: {bc}not including (someone or something) {bc}except for (someone or something)

dt.t: The park was deserted {it}save for{/it} a few joggers.

shortdef: not including (someone or something) : except for (someone or something)

dt: {bc}to stop people from dying or being killed

dt.t: If you donate blood, you might {it}save a life{/it}.
The use of seat belts can {it}save lives{/it}.

shortdef: to stop people from dying or being killed
